Entries.default:
Atsura trudges toward you. He looks tired and haggard, and his robes are rumpled and torn, but he doesn't seem to notice any of this.

He is focused on you.

"I'm disappointed, Maia Rua." 

He turns to the sharpshooter.

"All due respect, boss - me being here has got nothing to do with the cause.

"I still believe, but... there's more at stake." 

Maia shifts her gaze over to you.
"Rauatai will accomplish wonders with this place, [Player Name]. It is a shame you won't be part of them."
"Why are we arguing about this when Eothas is destroying the cycle?"
"No. The Vailians will accomplish great things here."
"You think Rauatai's known hardship? The Pr√≠ncipi have thrived with no homeland. Ukaizo shall be theirs."
He cocks his head and gives you a pitying look.

"Are you truly so short-sighted? 

"Eothas will finish his work. And whatever comes next, I will see that Rauatai survives."

"Captain... Watcher. There's a right and a wrong about this, drawn as clearly as a line in the sand.

"I know what side I'm on." 

She grips her weapon and stares you down. Ishiza glances between you, seeming less certain.
He nods to his soldiers, who draw their weapons.
"It once did. Now, it is ours to take."

"They will leave it in shambles, just as their forefathers made a ruin of their empire.

"I shall not let that happen."
He cocks his head in puzzlement.

"This was never personal, [Player Name].

"This is about something greater than either of us."
